provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses, as per Table 2
provenance.rationale: CT scan is explicitly stated as a primary modality for the evaluation of tumor responses in the 'Tumor Assessments (Radiologic)' section.

provenance.textSnippet: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) can be conducted in cases where local laws/requirements mandate, but should have Sponsor approval prior to performing the MRI.
provenance.rationale: MRI is explicitly mentioned as an alternative imaging modality for tumor assessments in specific cases.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The chest is an explicitly defined body region to be evaluated as part of the tumor assessment procedure.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The abdomen is an explicitly defined body region to be evaluated as part of the tumor assessment procedure.

provenance.textSnippet: A baseline MRI (or CT if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain is to be performed on any subject with signs or symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor.
provenance.rationale: The brain is an explicitly defined body region to be evaluated for tumor assessment under specific clinical circumstances (symptoms of CNS involvement).

provenance.textSnippet: Response criteria will be assessed using RECIST (version 1.1).
provenance.rationale: RECIST version 1.1 is explicitly stated as the standard criteria for assessing tumor response.

provenance.textSnippet: 10 mm caliper measurement by clinical exam
provenance.rationale: Caliper measurement is explicitly listed as a method for assessing measurable lesions during a clinical exam as part of the tumor response evaluation.

provenance.textSnippet: Cytology and histology can be used to differentiate between partial response (PR) and complete response (CR) in rare cases.
provenance.rationale: Cytology and histology are explicitly mentioned as methods that can be used for tumor assessment to confirm response in specific situations.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines the imaging modalities (CT, MRI), body regions (chest, abdomen, brain), and assessment criteria (RECIST v1.1, Caliper Measurement, Cytology/Histology) for Tumor Assessments in Section 8 (Tumor Assessments (Radiologic)) and Appendix H.

components.name: NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17)

provenance.textSnippet: To assess the subject's health-related quality of life and symptoms, two questionnaires will be administered: the NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17)
provenance.rationale: This questionnaire is explicitly listed as one of the two instruments used for the Quality of Life Assessment.

provenance.textSnippet: questionnaire and the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D-5L).
provenance.rationale: This questionnaire is explicitly listed as the second of two instruments used for the Quality of Life Assessment.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly decomposes the 'QoL Questionnaires' activity into two specific, named questionnaires in Section 5.3.1.1 on page 50.

provenance.textSnippet: Plasma concentrations of veliparib will be determined using validated methods under the supervision of the Drug Analysis Department at AbbVie.
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly states that plasma concentrations of veliparib will be measured from the collected pharmacokinetic samples.

provenance.textSnippet: Plasma concentrations of veliparib metabolite(s) may be determined using validated or non-validated methods.
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly states that plasma concentrations of veliparib metabolite(s) may be measured from the collected pharmacokinetic samples.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines two components to be measured from the Veliparib PK samples on page 53: 'Plasma concentrations of veliparib' and 'Plasma concentrations of veliparib metabolite(s)'.
